name: Painkiller (The Mothership)
instructions:
1. Add all of the ingredients except the tonic water to a shaker with crushed ice.
2. Briefly shake, then pour everything into a double Old Fashioned glass.
3. Add more crushed ice, then top with chilled tonic water.
4. Garnish.
description: For this spirit-free Painkiller recipe, Mothership owner Ricky Ramirez introduces tonic water to the mix. “It adds a bittering effect where you’d never know it’s nonalcoholic,” he says.

ingredients.name: Pineapple juice
ingredients.description: Pineapple juice is extracted by passing fresh, ripe pineapple through a juice extractor (juicer) or by muddling fresh cut pineapple chunks and then straining out the solids.

ingredients.name: Cream of Coconut
ingredients.description: Coconut cream is a thick, rich, and smooth substance extracted from the flesh of mature coconuts. Coconut cream is similar to coconut milk, but it has a higher concentration of coconut solids, giving it a thicker consistency. It is often used in both savory and sweet recipes, including curries, soups, desserts, and beverages. Coconut cream is a key ingredient in many dishes in Southeast Asian, Caribbean, and other tropical cuisines.

ingredients.name: Tonic
ingredients.description: Tonic water is a carbonated beverage that is flavored with quinine, a bitter compound derived from the bark of the cinchona tree. Originally used as a prophylactic against malaria due to its quinine content, tonic water has evolved into a popular mixer for various cocktails, especially the classic Gin and Tonic.
